I just did are you retarded?

Fuck me sideways.

item.title: Found this in my Client.java
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

[quote=“MoparScaperDude, post:11, topic:230753”] if (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 747 && !playerRights >= 1) // unequips weapon if you aren't the required Rights - The Reaper { remove(playerEquipment[playerWeapon], 3); sendMessage("You can't wield such power"); PoisonPlayer(); }

747 - Glowing Dagger
Reaper, I added that code for glowing dagger must be mod+, when I compile i get this:

client.java:18401: operator ! cannot be applied to int
if (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 747 && !playerRights >= 1) // unequ
ips weapon if you aren’t the required Rights - The Reaper
^
Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
1 error
Finished!
Press any key to continue . . .

What’s up?[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Found this in my Client.java
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

[quote=“MoparScaperDude, post:1, topic:230753”] if (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 1419 && !playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("The Reaper")) // unequips weapon if your name isn't The Reaper - The Reaper { remove(playerEquipment[playerWeapon], 3); sendMessage("You can't wield such power"); PoisonPlayer(); }

That stops anyone from weilding weapon 1419 [Scythe] unless their name is The Reaper

How can I make it so they cant weild it unless they are staff members? Or, add more names.[/quote]
Add playerRights =??..

item.title: Found this in my Client.java
item.dc:creator: @Retard_Monkey Retard Monkey
item.description:
@Retard_Monkey wrote:

Ahhh i see where I went wrong. I was adding:

!playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("The Reaper") || !playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("MoparScaperDude") || !playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Retard Monkey")) {

As opposed to two brackets after each.
Thanks Reaper!

Read full topic

item.title: Found this in my Client.java
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

lol… none of you helped him…

change this - !playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“The Reaper”))

to this - !playerRights >= 1)

! means isn’t/not.

so the whole line means “if the player doesn’t have the rights of 1 or above” (mod or above). I don’t like that code though because there’s ways to beat it. I don’t think anyone besides me knows how though. you should learn about your CL coding. this is good for now though, it’s what i used for a while at least. ;]

whole thing should look like this -

if (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 1419 && !playerRights >= 1) // unequips weapon if you aren't the required Rights - The Reaper { remove(playerEquipment[playerWeapon], 3); sendMessage("You can't wield such power"); PoisonPlayer(); }

Remember to remove the "PoisonPlayer(); part if you don’t want it in there.

edit:
oh and if you wanted to add more names instead, just put || in front of the names.

example: !playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“The Reaper”)) || !playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“MoparScaperDude”)) || !playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Retard Monkey”)) etc.

add as many as you’d like, there isn’t a limit.

Read full topic

item.title: Found this in my Client.java
item.dc:creator: @Retard_Monkey Retard Monkey
item.description:
@Retard_Monkey wrote:

You could just delete the entire thing, but then anybody could wield it.
Anyway, anyone can wield it, provided they have a weapon equiped and an otherwise full inventory. Then, there is no room for it to go in their backback so it stays on.
